cards.flavor_text: [i]The Injectors covertly roam the streets, turning critics into converts or monsters.[/i]

[i]“This humble one believe our existence and its value requires little explanation.”
—Akaaja, Steel Chancellor[/i]
[i]“Rat, human, or urdon, the trains exist to get you where you need to be.”[/i]
[i]“More than ever, those steeped in sin need our guidance. It is wrong to shirk that duty for Erysian ‘improvements.'”[/i]
[i]“Do not fret. The walls of Svakarataja will never condone Erysian heresy.”[/i]

[i]“Stop whining about being ‘disfigured.' The weak act against their interests.”
—Erys[/i]
[i]Exploiting a loophole in the umwelt laws, some of Percitha's interrogators changed their legal species to Womens Rea.[/i]

[i]“An entire city of vermin versus but one of my daughters. I'm impressed it's a draw!”
—Novablast, Urdonic Primarch[/i]

[i]“The burdent's sacred affairs have suffered unburdent meddling for long enough.”
— Novablast, Urdonic Primarch[/i]
[i]Split from his host, Lightning Fallamir lost his sense of purpose. What is a wolf without a vassal? What is a sword without a wielder?[/i]
[i]A humble first step for Erys' salvation.[/i]
[i]Producing the serum that turns anyone into an urdon is half of Percitha's economy.[/i]
[i]“You shouldn't anger your superiors like that, morsel.”[/i]

[i]“No more will strong and weak exist. No more will the genetic lottery enslave us.”
—First Decree of Erys[/i]

[i]“Why take pride in your frail bodies? They are the source of all oppression.” 
— Erys[/i]
[i]“What a stupid idea. Stop thinking about it.”[/i]
[i]“I finally agree with my old Callwolf enemies: When law is evil, crime isn't.”[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]“Fine. Let my dream burn with me,” scowled Erys to his son. “The willfully stupid don't deserve my salvation.”[/i]

[i]“Being a hex, a parasite, is a disease,” cooed Driaja.”And erysium is the cure.”
Karaja brandished her sacred spear, praying she would never turn against one of her own ever again.[/i]
[i]“To hell with urdonkind's iron fist! They think their strength deserves respect; Now they'll have to respect [/i]me![i]”[/i]
[i]As an erysite, Lightning could have protected everyone... But he saw that such smothering, omnipotent love would be mere tyranny.[/i]
[i]“I love my job, but I wish the state was more upfront on who I'd be sired onto.”[/i]
